snippet: The Food and Drug Administration approved a second weight-loss drug on Tuesday after years of caution stemming from the heart damage caused by a drug used in the fen-phen diet pill combination.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves Qsymia weight loss drug, previously known as Qnexa, developed by Vivus; Qsymia is second weight-loss drug, after Belviq, to gain approval in the last month; no new prescription weight-loss drugs have been approved in 13 years, and options for the one-third of American adults who are obese were limited and rarely prescribed.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration approved a second weight-loss drug on Tuesday after years of caution stemming from the heart damage caused by a drug used in the fen-phen diet pill combination.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Approves Qsymia, a Weight-Loss Drug
headline.main: F.D.A. Approves Qsymia, a Weight-Loss Drug
headline.print_headline: After 13-Year Drought, the F.D.A. Approves a Second Drug for Weight Loss
